bibl.title: The Emblems of Excellence in Pindar's First and Third Olympian Odes and Bacchylides' Third Epinician.
bibl.note: The pillars of Heracles at the end of the third Olympian ode stands for the Olympian victory, the ultimate achievement, being superior to 'most excellent' water and 'awesome' gold, allusions to Isthmus and Delphi. Bacchylides may use a similar symbolism in the alleged imitation of Pindar in vv. 85-92 of the third Epinician, where of the symbols which he designates as secret the pure aether would indicate Olympia; sea water Isthmus; and mirthful gold the festival of the Pythia. - Avec résumés en latin et en anglais.
